Speculative Design

By Conor Organ. 27/4/2016

People’s state of mind are generated from people and places they have been in their life. These experiences can affect your personality, thought process and decision making. This can lead you to have preconceived ideas about the world. As a designer this is bad, You want to be able to create things that haven’t been thought about rather than be stuck in the past.

“The people I’ve met, and the places I’ve been / Are all what make me the man I so proudly am” - Kid Cudi

Artists are very good at this sort of thing, artists such as Lawrence Malstaf, Franko B and Grayson Perry all have done exhibits that look at anti-design and the outlandish. Lawrence Malstaf set up an exhibit in 2010 where people shrink wrapped themselves between 2 pieces of plastic with nothing but a breathing tube. This exhibit was to showcase the initial fear to the calming sense of danger. At first you feel scared because basic human instinct is to be frightened when things are closing in on you fast. After you realise your okay the sense of calm hits you.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=2rZM0bKZ8a0

Syd Mead, best known for his designs for sci-films or what he has called them “reality ahead of schedule”.
